rComments: This prof thinks he is the best ever and thinks he is so cool since his tests are super hard when really he is the worst ever. I wish this prof can see that if the test averages are 50-60s that implies that no one knows what is going on and his teaching style is ineffective. Really wish I did not take this class with him. I learned nothing.

Hilarious doesn't help, his lecture is hard to follow. Have no interest in this course, and he makes it a lot harder. He is away for an awful lot of time, and TA would teach during tutorials. Fingers crossed for me to pass this course.
He is an absolute stubborn professor with zero pity in student's bad condition.

He is a very memorable prof. Many dislike his style but I found him to be very respectable and kept me engaged during every single lecture. His tests can be very intense but if you pay attention in class and take the time to learn/review all the content then you should pass no problem. Time and effort is the key to success here

Although people do complain about him, ECO204 is a difficult course in general and he tries to explain the material as best as he can in class using jokes and humour to keep students attention. It actually helps me from falling asleep in class so I will say it is effective. He even writes his own textbooks for students to use and it is very helpful
Either you love him or you hate him. There is no in-between.
Very challenging course that you must take if you are going for Finance. Not only his materials are applicable in work, he also prepares you for higher level courses.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Hilarious', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: As a prof/educator he is A+++ , very qualified to teach this course, knows what he is talking about, very engaging, great speaker, relatively fair test maker and grader. As a person... certified meany but a meany worth your time and tuition. Proceed with caution.

RUDEST PROFESSOR EVER! HE INTERRUPTS STUDENTS MID PRESENTATION TO MAKE STUDENT LOOK STUPID, WHEN REALLY HE'S THE ONE LOOKING LIKE A FOOL. HE ALSO MAKES DISRESPECTFUL FACES WHILE STUDENTS ARE SPEAKING. Everyone knows that judges ask questions at the end of a presentation, and they are certainly not asked by interrupting and with annoyed looks.

ECO204 is the easiest course I've ever taken at Rotman / UofT. People who complain about the (non-existent) "difficulty" of this course should re-evaluate their life decisions because it's not hard to get a 4.0 in this course if you have a positive IQ. Ajaz needs to make this course harder. This is UofT, not Ryerson man.

If I could rate him 0, I would. The content in this course is very difficult itself, and this man has the audacity to make it even harder! Pretty sure all the good reviews about him are written by him or his offspring. The man insults Rotman MBA students, students goes to the Canadian Harvard... when he went to Brown.

HARDEST CLASS AND PROFESSOR EVER! He makes concepts very challenging compared to other professors. His Ryerson jokes were funny the first week but not anymore. Making us do presentations infront of 400 students... whereas other sections do not have to do this. It is really unfair.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Don't take his eco204
Most ridiculous professor ever. reported and complained formally by 1k+ students I DON'T KNOW WHY HE'S STILL TEACHING. GO BACK TO USA

Take ECO204 with him if you have a finance job interview. He assumes everyone will go into Finance and is taking certain courses (i.e. RSM332, ECO220). The contents are not difficult but the tests are unreasonably long .
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Test heavy']

rComments: Ajaz is awesome, really funny and smart. His tests are challenging but fair. The final exam was graded very hard though. He knows his stuff and is a solid choice for a prof!

Not enough practice questions in each chapter (7-20 if any) and his chapters are identical to lecture slideshows which are huge. Prof stormed out in the middle of a lecture (scheduled a make up lecture on a Sunday) He gives hints to the tests in class (some test questions he answers verbally in class and doesn't include the info on slides or book)
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: ECO 204 is the toughest mandatory course at Rotman. However, Professor Hussain makes it enjoyable. He is a top-level lecturer and can be very funny at times (will make fun of Ryerson at least 5 times a semester). He admits the course is difficult so he makes sure students do not fall behind. He marks tough but curves grades up (B- average).

This professor is one of the jewels of UofT's Economic Department/Rotman Commerce. Absolutely a pleasure having him early on in undergrad, set the tone for the rest of the degree. If i had to name the top beneficial courses it would be his. Also, he's fun to be in class with and cares if you try hard. READ HIS NOTES AND LISTEN TO HIM!!!
Great professor! ECO204 is a must take. Explains everything really well. Learnt more from that one class than i have in any of my other Rotman classes.
Amazing prof! Learnt a lot more from eco204 than I did from most Rotman courses.
He changed his teaching style this year and I loved it! Read his textbook, that gives you more intuition
great prof

Great prof, funny lectures. Tests are very lecture and textbook based, so if a topic is in both lectures and the textbook, it'll definitely be on the exam. The topics are difficult but he takes time to explain the complex parts.

As an accounting specialist, I found this course was heavily geared towards finance/eco students. Also, the material was COMPLEX. Don't skip class and if you don't keep on top of the readings and lectures you're bound to fail. Take it from me, I bombed the 1st two tests but in the long run, there are ways to make up your grades. Funny lectures!
Hard class... at least hes kinda funny
Great prof overall but if you don't do as he says, you are done. Work hard and go to class and he will love you for it. Skip class and his test will kill you :) Good Luck!

If you listen closely and pay attention in class (writing notes) and supplimenting that with a read of his textbook (+ doing the homework), you should be alright. Oh, and don't expect something not to be on the test. If he mentioned it, chances it will be there. Beware of subtle hints.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Respected', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: this guys the best. by the far the best teacher i have had in rotman. explains thing amazingly and actually cares about students and will make try to make a relationship with you. super easy to talk to for advice. he challenges you so if you arent smart dont complain that his tests are hard

Professor Ajaz is a great prof overall. His lectures are really funny and he tries hard to explain the EXTREMELY COMPLEX material. The tests are super hard though and I found that it was geared mostly to Finance/Econ specialists. As an accounting specialist who hates Eco, I struggled alot with the course.

The greatest professor I have had a Rotman so far. He explains the theoretical concepts exceptionally well and then applies them to real life examples to teach practical uses. If you are a mgmt/accounting specialist and dont want a future in economics or finance, avoid him as he is very tough and expects you to know all concepts to the core.

Ajaz is so excellent and we can learn so many things in his lecture. He provides some concepts in RSM 332 so that we can prepare well before we take RSM332. He has his own text book and the contents are very clear. The best Prof I met in my second year.

I was skipping his classes now I regretted. Not that my mark was low, but that I didn't learn everything from him. I am taking Financial Risk Management exam I now and there are handful of content that were covered by him in ECO204. Including but not limited to VaR, Monte-Carlo simulation, Capital Market Lines etc. I hope I could express my thanks.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Hilarious', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Man, this guy sucks. I've taken a ton of math in undergrad and this guy can't explain a mathematical concept for his life. Sure, he's funny and keep things light, but is just an awful instructor who can't explain simple concepts at all. If you ask a question, he'll likely cut you off and try to answer before you even get your question across.
Worst Prof ever. Like enough said. Don't take his course.
The worst prof at UofT. The material taught is useless and difficult and his teaching style doesn't help. Avoid at all costs. Save your 2nd year GPA and stay away from this man.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: horroible accent. You could hardly understanding wtf he is talking in the lecture except some dirty jokes. His pronunciation is really unclear. He should not be teaching.

Thanks to Ajaz 3rd & 4th year was a breeze ! Kids who say the other profs are easier forget that they will write an exam created, in most part, by Ajaz so no way of getting around that. If you are in Economics and Accounting and you don't take you will most likely struggle in upper years because it only gets harder from here - yet Ajaz will prep u!

BEST Prof for ECO204! Because of him I managed to get 75-80% i n all my 3rd year finance course. He is not that hard compared to the other profs + he writes 90% of the exam since he teaches the most sections. The way he teaches you really helps you with upper year courses since you gotta learn the material anyway - better to learn it now! THE BEST!

I DO NOT RECOMMEND  TAKING ECO204 WITH AJAZ. unless you are  some next genius or are really talented in economics, taking it with him is not worth it. I tried so hard and did terrible, never thought i would do so badly in university. this course took over my life, the exam was insanely difficult and i wish someone told me to stay away from him!!
He is the best instructor i ever had in u of t, test are extremely hard, if you skip his class, you wont pass for sure. really tough test but i miss him

Easily one of the most useful lectures I have ever attended. He can be insensitive towards your feelings but that should be understandable if you are not too easily butthurt. And for whoever complaining about the difficulty of the course, it is MEANT to be challenging, or why do you think we are called UofTEARS??
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'So many papers']

rComments: The stupidest professor i have ever seen. Poor teaching quality, like to make fun in class through dirty and boring jokes, so much mistakes in course materials. Always waste students' time to do lots of meaningless things. His lectures are so confusing and always makes things more harder than it should be. Soooooo stupid.

Ajaz seems like a funny person, but beware. 204 is one of the hardest courses offered at UofT and he is a large reason why. Take Karen (or another prof) if at all possible - most of Karen's feedback is old and her students last year got a ton of easy and free marks.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Ajaz's lectures are mediocre at best because he attempts to make concepts harder than they really are. You can do well without attending his lectures, which are graph heavy, and self study for tests, which are number heavy. By the end of the course, you will be happy to never hear his repetitive jokes.

You will hate this class and you will hate this prof in the moment. You will stay up for hours reading his hand-made PDF textbook while pulling your hair out. You will lose all hope during the exams. You will pass the course with a fantastic grade because of a 40% curve. You will look back and realize he taught you how to learn properly and timeman
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Professor Ajaz is an incredibly poor pedagogue.  He is best described as an extreme narcissist; he spends as much time berating  students for misunderstanding his poorly worded lectures as he does teaching.  He is notorious for being unavailable, unwilling to answer questions, and generally uncaring about his student's learning.  Avoid at all costs

Literally best prof of all time. As long as you have decent math foundations and do all required work, you'll be fine. Textbook is not necessarily required because his lectures and slides are very clear. This course is not as scary as it seems. Projects are very useful.
One of the best profs at U of T! Very easily approchable and his projects are very usefull. One of the most usefull courses at U of T that I have ever taken.
Great prof, great class, but get ready to work.

One of the best professors in North America. Super enthusiastic about a boring topic. Keeps class engaged. The course itself is incredibly tough, and thus explaining the difficulty of the exams, and the lower averages. It's a course where brains and smartness doesn't help, only hard work can get you somewhere.

Professor Hussain is the best prof I've had at UofT!  It's been over a year since I graduated from UofT but I now value how he pushes you to excel and truly understand the concepts instead of counting on mere memorization. Hilarious, informative and all around great guy!

At the beginning the classes were okay because the materials were relatively simple and he cracks jokes here and there. However, towards the end of the course, his jokes got old and he was very unorganized (i.e. missed class, cancelled a exam Q&A session, a lot of mistakes on practice question solutions,etc)

The most entertaining prof one can hope to come across. Makes economic sense, ensuring you understand the material and also don't fall asleep in class, thanks to his tequila jokes. Lectures material is very useful, though can get a bit too much at times. Overall tough course, but effective prof and hilarious lectures.

I found Ajaz very delightful. He was a straight forward prof and explained the material as well as he could. My advice to potential students is to be super keen in his course. If you are the results will definitely follow. It seems hard on the surface but the concepts are easy when you put pen to paper.

It's now 2 years after completing this course and surprisingly passing it. It is quite traumatizing when taking it and after the final exam, you pretty much feel like a failure but you learn a lot through his real life examples. Most of the logic behind the algebra is very challenging to understand though. But Ajaz is a funny and friendly prof!

ridiculous professor. lecture slides are totally useless. tutorial is actually more useful than his lecture. And he only bell curve by percentage, which only makes high mark higher and low mark lower relatively.

Crazy dictator ! He doesn't care about anything! Lectures were entertaining at times and material was interesting but when going through some of the algebra on the home works or trying to figure out excel for his assignments you can really develop a hatred for him.
Professor Ajaz is a great professor! I ever had at university! His curriculum is very hard, but u learn a lot. I will say it again, the most amazing professor at U of T. Five stars to prof Ajaz!

The guys who complain are the ones who don't put in the work. Ajaz's class will push boundaries and show you how to think critically in a more effective way than anyone else. He is hilarious, helpful, and crystal clear. If you put in a little bit of work, you will do just fine. Amazing experience overall and I look forward to taking ECO404.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE professor. Just throws random assignment that the class had never learned about. His curriculum is ridiculous. It's a shame that the rotman students have to tolerate this prof since he is the only one who is currently teaching ECO204. Just take ECO206. That is all I can say!

There are professors who make their classes challenging because they really want students to learn and push their boundaries.  And there are those who make their classes challenging because they are masochistic.  I am convinced that, though he appears to be in of the first type, Ajaz is actually of the second.  That being said, ECO404 is okay.

I was unlucky to come across Prof. Ajaz for Stats. Unlike other profs, he is completely disconnected with the rest of the program, posting enormous assignments during the busiest times. His slides complicate the topics to make them look "important" and are basically useless. This guy wants attention. Give it to him and you'll get a good grade.
horrible.  absolute ignorance and inability to convey knowledge to students.

You learn a lot in this class. Clear lectures and expectations. Inconsistent difficulties for tests throughout the year but they do bell curve to normalize the avg. You need to go to class and keep up with the work to do well but the content isn't impossible.
Very helpful if you ask for help. Go to his office hours!!

Very hard course. However, Ajaz is definitely one of the best profs I've ever had. I enjoyed attending his lecture, it is funny and intuitive. If u wanna pass the course, attend all lectures, tutorial and do all the tutorial problem sets.

His teaching skills are great! It goes beyond the classroom life into in the real world. His Micro news postings brings out the reality of the course; read everyone of them! I love his passion about his work -- in writing his own book and criticizing others! Hmm.... I must be having a crush on him right now...sigh!

Knows his stuff. Makes tests too long to control the class average.  Unorganized. Funny to the younger crowd - gets repetitive.  Writes his own chapters - only learn through his point of view.  You can learn more if you utilize his office hours - reach out.
My favourite prof. Funny guy, very smart, too. You can learn a lot from him.

This prof is a good lecturer. He's very funny and explains concepts clearly. One of the best lecturers @ u of T. However, his tests are extremely difficult. After exams, you feel like you have failed your life. In fact, that's what he aims for - raping students. So, don't wipe your ass when you take your exams, and you will be okay.
I think Ajaz is a pretty kool guy. Eh teaches economics and doesn't afraid of anything.

He's the prof you won't forget about after graduating. This course is tough but you need to make the most of it. You need to take good notes, practice questions and actually treat it as a learning experience. His classes were never boring and taught you to think in a different way.  If you put in the effort you should be able to get a decent mark.

Great professor in terms of what you will learn in his class and how in depth your understanding of the material will be, that being said his exams are TOUGH, and he is often unorganized when it comes to administration.. he is however the best prof in terms of quality that i have come across at UofT.. dont neglect the material and you should be ok
Amazing professor! Really cares about his students. Micro theory isn't easy, but he tries to bring it down to earth. People who complain just aren't willing to do the work.
he appears to be a sad lonely man.

Not bad as far as teaching goes, lectures are effective but he tends to ramble. Clear speaker but, contradicts self in HWs. 2 Major problems with him; he is writing the "textbook" but releases the chapters literally a day before tests, says that we should be fine studying from lecture slides. Secondly, his tests are always too long, and bell curved

He's one of the best lecturer I've ever had...even though i'm no doing so great, but I love his classes a lot! He's the type of prof that even though i'm not doing so great, but still wanna write him a thankyou card. The TAs he seleted are also very good in general...I actually wanna attend more of his lectures ,without taking his tests that is~ XD
Interesting speaker

Great guy, does his best to make sure students understand the material, material is tough but if you're going to continue to complain drop out of business school. It's always good having a professor that genuinely wants his students to succeed.
The best professor in U of T. He cares about students and very helpful. I never miss the class even though there's no attendance required. The lectures are very interesting and useful.
I like you but you are hard. Thank you.
Very good at explaining, but tests are very hard. Though, to be fair, he gave us plenty of warning that they would be difficult.
Bad, very bad.
he has the nicest hairs ive ever seen
I love your hair
Such an enthusiastic, hardworking, and knowledgable prof, and funny as well.

This guy is retarded out of his mind.. seems to know his stuff really well and teaches in a gr8 way. only to his surprise 99% of people in his class have no clue wats going on... evidence can be seen on his test one where he bellcurved by 30 marks. clearly showing how no one understands what he does and difficulty is insane. if in commerce u will t

The most personable and likeable faculty member in Rotman Commerce. Although I believe 95% of students don't know what the hell is going on during the lectures. He clearly knows what he is doing. His tests are extremely difficult!!!!!! Test 1 for 2009 was a dismal failure for most and had to be bell curved significantly.
This prof is awesome. He is smart, funny, bald, and doesn't afraid of anything. Inb4 hard/fair tests, funny/interesting lectures, blah blah, etc...
WARNING: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF. POOR TEACHING STYLE AND HARD TESTS. IF YOU WANT TO PASS DON'T TAKE THIS GUY

He shows you how to apply eco concepts it in a simple way to real life things, but it requires you to have common sense. The tests were fair, sometimes the questions were difficult.Do the problem sets!..DO NOT buy the textbook it's absolutely useless..He did a really good job at introducing us to case studies.He very helpful when you have questions

Great lectures, it is essential to go to class, else slides are useless. Very good homework problem. did not use textbook, so dont buy it. test difficulty depended on how class did last time. if this test class did good, next time the test is super hard
makes me want to go to class every week

He is indeed THE BEST prof I've seen in my life. I love the way he lectures. He definitely spices up the lectures with his jokes and real life examples. If any other prof was teaching this course, I might have hated it. I really do look forward to his lectures each week. This surely does not mean it is an easy course, common sense is required :)
lectures were fun but impossible to understand and follow along. tests were way too hard. only good thing was aplia
He is the best prof i've ever met.He is very funny and very helpful. However, his classes are hard. He forces u to think:D

He represents what I like to see on a typical *professor*: not only a teacher, in the sense that he does question the institutions, explores the boundaries, forces you to think and not only accept the world the way it is. I liked his approach a lot because I already have some work experience. He gave me a framework beyond the textbook

ECO204 is the class that I look forward to every week!! I love the way he lectures, he loves to use real life example and joke around, that really helps me remember the material. However, you really have to work hard in this class (not as hard as ECO220 though!) For those who find his class boring, maybe you should start going and PAYING ATTENTION!
he will change your life, but be careful, it's never an easy course
Not a good professor. Doesn't know how to lecture and explain concepts well. Very unorganised and confusing. Unfortunately if u are in commerce u have to deal with him.
Very good professor. You can really learn something from his courses. Focus on case studies which is extrememly important.

I have mixed feelings about Ajaz. Hes one of the nicest and most helpful professors ive had and his lectures were lots of fun. But at the same time, i didnt like his presentation of material. he managed to make really simple economic concepts really complex and his test questions were very strange, hard to understand and relate to what you studied
Really good prof, tests are tricky but if you attend lectures and think outside the box you'll do well. This prof will go out of his way to help you succeed
